doc.previous: The Prado Museum (Museo del Prado) is a museum and art gallery that features one of the world's finest collections of European art, from the 12th century to the early 19th century, based on the former Spanish Royal Collection. The collection currently comprises around 7,600 paintings, 1,000 sculptures, 4,800 prints and 8,200 drawings, in addition to a large number of works of art and historic documents. El Prado is one of the most visited museums in the world, and it is considered to be among the greatest museums of art. It has the best collection of artworks by Goya, VelÃ¡zquez, El Greco, Rubens, Titian, Hieronymus Bosch, JosÃ© de Ribera and Patinir; and works by Rogier van der Weyden, Raphael Sanzio, Tintoretto, Veronese, Caravaggio, Van Dyck, Albrecht DÃ¼rer, Claude Lorrain, Murillo and ZurbarÃ¡n, among others. Among the most famous paintings in this museum are 'Las Meninas,' âThe immaculate Conception,â and âThe judgement of Paris.'
